location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in approximate chronological order.

Foliation: The foliation sequence commences at the cover and terminates at the last folio; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An original pagination sequence in ink also runs throughout the volume.

mods.abstract: This file contains inward letters from the Government of Bombay plus enclosures from the Government of India to Captain David Wilson, the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. Subjects include Britainâ€™s relations with Persia and the Imam of Muscat, as well as issues concerning the Russo-Persian War and the new Persian currency.
